abstract: The Appraisal column; Pepe Montero, owner of Montero Bar and Grill, agrees to sell if he and six of his neighbors receive $56 million offer on row of their buildings along Atlantic Avenue in Brooklyn; bar, which opened in 1939 with longshoreman as its customers, has survived Robert Moses's building efforts, migration of area's shipping industry to New Jersey, crime and recession and influx of money into neighborhood.
lead_paragraph: Montero Bar and Grill, a family-owned bar that opened in 1939 with longshoremen as its patrons, is one in a stretch of buildings being offered for a potential sale.

headline.main: Tempting Offer Could Mean End of a Brooklyn Longshoreman’s Bar
headline.print_headline: $56 Million May Decide Fate of a Longshoreman’s Haunt

snippet: Montero Bar and Grill, a family-owned bar that opened in 1939 with longshoremen as its patrons, is one in a stretch of buildings being offered for a potential sale.
